PickMostRelevantLoop - Given two loops pick the one that&#39;s most relevant for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expansion.

If they are nested, this is the most nested. If they are neighboring, pick the later.

<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ReuseOrCreateCast - Arrange for there to be a cast of V to Ty at IP,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">/// reusing an existing cast if a suitable one (= dominating IP) exists, or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">/// creating a new one.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;SCEVExpander::ReuseOrCreateCast(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;Ty,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#afa0b2fa29ba074f2b6ec9ac11163f2d9">Instruction::CastOps</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> IP) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This function must be called with the builder having a valid insertion</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// point. It doesn&#39;t need to be the actual IP where the uses of the returned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// cast will be added, but it must dominate such IP.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We use this precondition to produce a cast that will dominate all its</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// uses. In particular, this is crucial for the case where the builder&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// insertion point &#42;is&#42; the point where we were asked to put the cast.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since we don&#39;t know the builder&#39;s insertion point is actually</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// where the uses will be added (only that it dominates it), we are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// not allowed to move it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> BIP = Builder.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/irbuilderbase/#a4e5c1b91bf5e2860398e3fa35c96b5af">GetInsertPoint</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;Ret = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check to see if there is already a cast!</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> &#42;U : V-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a411cf3e3932f209ce3374cb31adc1da6">users</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (U-&gt;getType() != Ty)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst">CastInst</a> &#42;CI = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;CastInst&gt;</a>(U);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!CI || CI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/castinst/#a3685b2128d8e6917000e4adc3b266ff6">getOpcode</a>() != <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">continue</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Found a suitable cast that is at IP or comes before IP. Use it. Note that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the cast must also properly dominate the Builder&#39;s insertion point.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (IP-&gt;getParent() == CI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-detail/node-parent-access/#a7e19e7508415378ad9523e0339b23e22">getParent</a>() &amp;&amp; &amp;&#42;BIP != CI &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">        (&amp;&#42;IP == CI || CI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#a784097fca76abad9e815cf1692de79c4">comesBefore</a>(&amp;&#42;IP))) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">      Ret = CI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">break</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Create a new cast.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Ret) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">    SCEVInsertPointGuard Guard(Builder, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">    Builder.SetInsertPoint(&amp;&#42;IP);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mipsisd/#a422daf9aa810935178671306b651d69ba366e1eac31eeb1a1892d62ccfc0c8cf8">Ret</a> = Builder.CreateCast(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>, V, Ty, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/m68k/#ab3a288f2953d8eca3e363959fc2cf38ea5206560a306a2e085a437fd258eb57ce">V</a>-&gt;getName());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We assert at the end of the function since IP might point to an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction with different dominance properties than a cast</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="comment">/// expandAddToGEP - Expand an addition expression with a pointer type into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="comment">/// a GEP instead of using ptrtoint+arithmetic+inttoptr. This helps</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="comment">/// BasicAliasAnalysis and other passes analyze the result. See the rules</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for getelementptr vs. inttoptr in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="comment">/// http://llvm.org/docs/LangRef.html#pointeraliasing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for details.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Design note: The correctness of using getelementptr here depends on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ScalarEvolution not recognizing inttoptr and ptrtoint operators, as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><Highlight kind="comment">/// they may introduce pointer arithmetic which may not be safely converted</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><Highlight kind="comment">/// into getelementptr.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Design note: It might seem desirable for this function to be more</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loop-aware. If some of the indices are loop-invariant while others</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><Highlight kind="comment">/// aren&#39;t, it might seem desirable to emit multiple GEPs, keeping the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loop-invariant portions of the overall computation outside the loop.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349"><Highlight kind="comment">/// However, there are a few reasons this is not done here. Hoisting simple</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><Highlight kind="comment">/// arithmetic is a low-level optimization that often isn&#39;t very</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="351"><Highlight kind="comment">/// important until late in the optimization process. In fact, passes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="352"><Highlight kind="comment">/// like InstructionCombining will combine GEPs, even if it means</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="353"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pushing loop-invariant computation down into loops, so even if the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="comment">/// GEPs were split here, the work would quickly be undone. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="comment">/// LoopStrengthReduction pass, which is usually run quite late (and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="comment">/// after the last InstructionCombining pass), takes care of hoisting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loop-invariant portions of expressions, after considering what</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="comment">/// can be folded using target addressing modes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;SCEVExpander::expandAddToGEP(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="normal">                                    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6f">SCEV::NoWrapFlags</a> Flags) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;Instruction&gt;</a>(V) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363"><Highlight kind="normal">         SE.DT.dominates(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;Instruction&gt;</a>(V), &amp;&#42;Builder.GetInsertPoint()));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;Idx = expand(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><Highlight kind="normal">  GEPNoWrapFlags NW = (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-textstubv5-cpp-/#ad2f3f81faa370c8bf9a1f81612c90adfab74797a67aabe2a47afe04d0a92997a0">Flags</a> &amp; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#af43000d4dcb7d6d63cb6e36933ed3f6faafb62cd6afdc004ef6e8a1f6288eb382">SCEV::FlagNUW</a>) ? <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gepnowrapflags/#a5bfde791508b16caf8509e95a8fdf7b9">GEPNoWrapFlags::noUnsignedWrap</a>()</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><Highlight kind="normal">                                              : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gepnowrapflags/#ad41d3c975038ec4a4fc791601729124e">GEPNoWrapFlags::none</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Fold a GEP with constant operands.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Constant &#42;CLHS = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;Constant&gt;</a>(V))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Constant &#42;CRHS = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;Constant&gt;</a>(Idx))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Builder.CreatePtrAdd(CLHS, CRHS, </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, NW);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Do a quick scan to see if we have this GEP nearby.  If so, reuse it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="375"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ScanLimit = 6;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00378" /><CodeLine lineNumber="378"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> IP = Builder.GetInsertPoint();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00383" /><CodeLine lineNumber="383"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// generated code.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00384" /><CodeLine lineNumber="384"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;DbgInfoIntrinsic&gt;</a>(IP))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><Highlight kind="comment">/// PickMostRelevantLoop - Given two loops pick the one that&#39;s most relevant for</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><Highlight kind="comment">/// getRelevantLoop - Get the most relevant loop associated with the given</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Test whether we&#39;ve already computed the most relevant loop for this SCEV.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Pair = RelevantLoops.insert(std::make&#95;pair(S, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Pair.first-&gt;second;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">switch</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (S-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#ad4f956914bf94bdcd1058badb5bd90e6">getSCEVType</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad409632178dd00316abd4c35d3e14b5eabcb1f797cb330e61a5879fc260aaec5b">scConstant</a>:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If one operand is a non-constant negative and the other is not,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// put the non-constant negative on the right so that a sub can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = OpsAndLoops.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a8a045d250952c0867382a9840ee18fdf">begin</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Expand the calculation of X pow N in the following manner:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Let N = P1 + P2 + ... + PK, where all P are powers of 2 Then:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// X pow N = (X pow P1) &#42; (X pow P2) &#42; ... &#42; (X pow PK).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ExpandOpBinPowN = &#91;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>, &amp;OpsAndLoops&#93;() &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a> = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Calculate how many times the same operand from the same loop is included</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into this power.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><Highlight kind="normal">    uint64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a403260df3a211e47e65f35fbfd9bee8faf5ccb8d51ca38e2f3329955fc0149cd4">Exponent</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> uint64&#95;t MaxExponent = <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/datatypes-h/#a30654b4b67d97c42ca3f9b6052dda916">UINT64&#95;MAX</a> &gt;&gt; 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No one sane will ever try to calculate such huge exponents, but if we</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// need this, we stop on UINT64&#95;MAX / 2 because we need to exit the loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// below when the power of 2 exceeds our Exponent, and we want it to be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1u &lt;&lt; 31 at most to not deal with unsigned overflow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a> != OpsAndLoops.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectortemplatecommon/#a075e34e98605d0e7c289763a104869ac">end</a>() &amp;&amp; &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> == &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a> &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a403260df3a211e47e65f35fbfd9bee8faf5ccb8d51ca38e2f3329955fc0149cd4">Exponent</a> != MaxExponent) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><Highlight kind="normal">      ++<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a403260df3a211e47e65f35fbfd9bee8faf5ccb8d51ca38e2f3329955fc0149cd4">Exponent</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><Highlight kind="normal">      ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#abb2b3a60ccc38a28239e19a1646e0c8a">E</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a403260df3a211e47e65f35fbfd9bee8faf5ccb8d51ca38e2f3329955fc0149cd4">Exponent</a> &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Trying to calculate a zeroth exponent of operand?&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Calculate powers with exponents 1, 2, 4, 8 etc. and include those of them</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that are needed into the result.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ok, the add recurrence looks usable.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Remember this PHI, even in post-inc mode.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><Highlight kind="normal">      InsertedValues.insert(AddRecPhiMatch);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Remember the increment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><Highlight kind="normal">      rememberInstruction(IncV);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Those values were not actually inserted but re-used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><Highlight kind="normal">      ReusedValues.insert(AddRecPhiMatch);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><Highlight kind="normal">      ReusedValues.insert(IncV);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> AddRecPhiMatch;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Save the original insertion point so we can restore it when we&#39;re done.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><Highlight kind="normal">  SCEVInsertPointGuard Guard(Builder, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Another AddRec may need to be recursively expanded below. For example, if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this AddRec is quadratic, the StepV may itself be an AddRec in this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loop. Remove this loop from the PostIncLoops set before expanding such</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// AddRecs. Otherwise, we cannot find a valid position for the step</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (i.e. StepV can never dominate its loop header).  Ideally, we could do</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SavedIncLoops.swap(PostIncLoops), but we generally have a single element,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// so it&#39;s not worth implementing SmallPtrSet::swap.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1234"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In canonical mode we compute the addrec as an expression of a canonical IV</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1235"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// using evaluateAtIteration and expand the resulting SCEV expression. This</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1236"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// way we avoid introducing new IVs to carry on the computation of the addrec</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1237"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// throughout the loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1238"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1239"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For nested addrecs evaluateAtIteration might need a canonical IV of a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1240"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// type wider than the addrec itself. Emitting a canonical IV of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1241"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// proper type might produce non-legal types, for example expanding an i64</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#123;0,+,2,+,1&#125; addrec would need an i65 canonical IV. To avoid this just fall</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1243"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// back to non-canonical mode for nested addrecs.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1591"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Remember the expanded value for this SCEV at this location.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1592"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01623" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1623"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sandboxir/#a75d3582b0f0bc7a5123de92ada301e97">Instruction</a> &#42;OrigInc =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1624"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;Instruction&gt;</a>(OrigPhi-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode/#ab2db7609ec72b1af2f91d47e40dc3722">getIncomingValueForBlock</a>(LatchBlock));</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01626" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1626"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;Instruction&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/rdf/#a379bee2dadbfd1d7a599f003c4275dd8">Phi</a>-&gt;getIncomingValueForBlock(LatchBlock));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1627"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!OrigInc || !IsomorphicInc)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1628"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1629"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1630"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this phi has the same width but is more canonical, replace the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1631"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// original with it. As part of the &quot;more canonical&quot; determination,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1632"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// respect a prior decision to use an IV chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1633"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OrigPhi-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a0344a49526443edf90cc0aef3abd3337">getType</a>() == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/rdf/#a379bee2dadbfd1d7a599f003c4275dd8">Phi</a>-&gt;getType() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1634"><Highlight kind="normal">      !(ChainedPhis.count(Phi) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1635"><Highlight kind="normal">        isExpandedAddRecExprPHI(OrigPhi, OrigInc, L)) &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1636"><Highlight kind="normal">      (ChainedPhis.count(Phi) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1637"><Highlight kind="normal">       isExpandedAddRecExprPHI(Phi, IsomorphicInc, L))) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1638"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/std/#ab8424022895aee3e366fb9a32f2883cb">std::swap</a>(OrigPhi, Phi);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1639"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/std/#ab8424022895aee3e366fb9a32f2883cb">std::swap</a>(OrigInc, IsomorphicInc);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1640"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1641"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1642"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Replacing the congruent phi is sufficient because acyclic</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1643"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// redundancy elimination, CSE/GVN, should handle the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1644"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// rest. However, once SCEV proves that a phi is congruent,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1645"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it&#39;s often the head of an IV user cycle that is isomorphic</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1646"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with the original phi. It&#39;s worth eagerly cleaning up the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1647"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// common case of a single IV increment so that DeleteDeadPHIs</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1648"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// can remove cycles that had postinc uses.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1649"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Because we may potentially introduce a new use of OrigIV that didn&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1650"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// exist before at this point, its poison flags need readjustment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1651"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SCEV &#42;TruncExpr =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01652" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1652"><Highlight kind="normal">      SE.getTruncateOrNoop(SE.getSCEV(OrigInc), IsomorphicInc-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#a0344a49526443edf90cc0aef3abd3337">getType</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01653" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1653"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OrigInc == IsomorphicInc || TruncExpr != SE.getSCEV(IsomorphicInc) ||</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01654" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1654"><Highlight kind="normal">      !SE.LI.replacementPreservesLCSSAForm(IsomorphicInc, OrigInc))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01655" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1655"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01656" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1656"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1657"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BothHaveNUW = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1658"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BothHaveNSW = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01659" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1659"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;OBOIncV = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;OverflowingBinaryOperator&gt;</a>(OrigInc);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1660"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;OBOIsomorphic = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;OverflowingBinaryOperator&gt;</a>(IsomorphicInc);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1661"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (OBOIncV &amp;&amp; OBOIsomorphic) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1662"><Highlight kind="normal">    BothHaveNUW =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1663"><Highlight kind="normal">        OBOIncV-&gt;hasNoUnsignedWrap() &amp;&amp; OBOIsomorphic-&gt;hasNoUnsignedWrap();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1664"><Highlight kind="normal">    BothHaveNSW =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1665"><Highlight kind="normal">        OBOIncV-&gt;hasNoSignedWrap() &amp;&amp; OBOIsomorphic-&gt;hasNoSignedWrap();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1666"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1667"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1668"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevexpander/#aa3255071e8195c43058f7e265c54677f">hoistIVInc</a>(OrigInc, IsomorphicInc,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1669"><Highlight kind="normal">                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;RecomputePoisonFlags&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1670"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1671"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1672"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We are replacing with a wider increment. If both OrigInc and IsomorphicInc</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1673"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are NUW/NSW, then we can preserve them on the wider increment; the narrower</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// negative. If Step is known to be positive or negative, only create</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2143"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// either 1 or 2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2144"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ComputeEndCheck = &#91;&amp;&#93;() -&gt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2145"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Checking &lt;u 0 is always false.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2146"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvptxisellowering-cpp/#ae1a90b5d85643644483b2ca70da4d13faed3fa7a5efe80dad3ea3d86cc14be246">Signed</a> &amp;&amp; Start-&gt;isZero() &amp;&amp; SE.isKnownPositive(Step))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2153"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Step-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev/#a1ecb726f4e7b445057b795ed500546a0">isOne</a>()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2154"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Special-case Step of one. Potentially-costly &#96;umul&#95;with&#95;overflow&#96; isn&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2157"><Highlight kind="normal">      MulV = TruncTripCount;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2158"><Highlight kind="normal">      OfMul = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constantint/#aa7cce62ac5cc6df09cce0535874336b7">ConstantInt::getFalse</a>(MulV-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#ab3fc0225d8aaf8434026c3573f961f2c">getContext</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2159"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2192"><Highlight kind="normal">          <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvptxisellowering-cpp/#ae1a90b5d85643644483b2ca70da4d13faed3fa7a5efe80dad3ea3d86cc14be246">Signed</a> ? <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba720a42e85f7e981afd61e28473b0000a">ICmpInst::ICMP&#95;SGT</a> : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba607cecdc5172814382033e001ed11fad">ICmpInst::ICMP&#95;UGT</a>, Sub, StartValue);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2193"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (NeedPosCheck &amp;&amp; NeedNegCheck) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2194"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Select the answer based on the sign of Step.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2195"><Highlight kind="normal">      EndCheck = Builder.CreateSelect(StepCompare, EndCompareGT, EndCompareLT);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2196"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2197"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Builder.CreateOr(EndCheck, OfMul);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2198"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;EndCheck = ComputeEndCheck();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2200"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2201"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the backedge taken count type is larger than the AR type,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2202"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// check that we don&#39;t drop any bits by truncating it. If we are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2203"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dropping bits, then we have overflow (unless the step is zero).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2204"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SrcBits &gt; DstBits) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2205"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxVal = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a331d69b5f93e47e7c596062b77dd5913">APInt::getMaxValue</a>(DstBits).<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint/#a1dc76cc8bf703e6ada68bededcbb9573">zext</a>(SrcBits);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;BackedgeCheck =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2207"><Highlight kind="normal">        Builder.CreateICmp(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba607cecdc5172814382033e001ed11fad">ICmpInst::ICMP&#95;UGT</a>, TripCountVal,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2208"><Highlight kind="normal">                           ConstantInt::get(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/loc">Loc</a>-&gt;getContext(), MaxVal));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><Highlight kind="normal">    BackedgeCheck = Builder.CreateAnd(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2210"><Highlight kind="normal">        BackedgeCheck, Builder.CreateICmp(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78bac17897ebf2f6a6986280fc3bdf28a30a">ICmpInst::ICMP&#95;NE</a>, StepValue, Zero));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2211"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><Highlight kind="normal">    EndCheck = Builder.CreateOr(EndCheck, BackedgeCheck);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2213"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2214"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2215"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> EndCheck;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2302"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2303"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2304"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2305"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Search for a SCEV subexpression that is not safe to expand.  Any expression</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2306"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that may expand to a !isSafeToSpeculativelyExecute value is unsafe, namely</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2307"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// UDiv expressions. We don&#39;t know if the UDiv is derived from an IR divide</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2308"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction, but the important thing is that we prove the denominator is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2309"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// nonzero before expansion.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2310"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2311"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// IVUsers already checks that IV-derived expressions are safe. So this check is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2312"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// only needed when the expression includes some subexpression that is not IV</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2313"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// derived.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2314"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2315"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Currently, we only allow division by a value provably non-zero here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2316"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2317"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We cannot generally expand recurrences unless the step dominates the loop</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2318"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// header. The expander handles the special case of affine recurrences by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2319"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// scaling the recurrence outside the loop, but this technique isn&#39;t generally</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2320"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// applicable. Expanding a nested recurrence outside a loop requires computing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2321"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// binomial coefficients. This could be done, but the recurrence has to be in a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2322"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// perfectly reduced form, which can&#39;t be guaranteed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2323" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-scalarevolutionexpander-cpp-/scevfindunsafe"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-scalarevolutionexpander-cpp-/scevfindunsafe/#a36e2c5bb0b6711bd6abf032bd6bc0fe8">SCEVFindUnsafe</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
